website_summaries.verdict: Combining the strength of natural wood with clean and modern design, this beautiful set is sure to compliment your bedroom decor.
pros: Both stylish and functional, these risers will give an extra 3.5 inches of space under the bed
They are also stackable for a full 7 inches of rise, while maintaining their sleek looks
cons: Some customers have reported that their set came more reddish in color than espresso

customer_reviews.title: NOT SOLID WOOD!!! Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT SOLID! These are a square wooden shell with a square block shoved in the center, and jammed there. The pictures show the extremely poor quality of the lifters I received. I held a flashlight behind the lifters so you could see how these are not only not solid, but even the wood they jammed inside had holes. As you can see, the finish was also damaged, and the stain job was sloppy and unfinish. They also have some kind of white film on them that won't come off. If your are considering these, you should pass. If you already own them, you should seriously check them out before you put any serious weight on these!
customer_reviews.author: Tada

customer_reviews.title: Solid wood desk application
customer_reviews.text: Works great. We used it on a solid wood desk that has round legs and weighs several hundred pounds. No issues. We were hesitant about the desk legs being round, but its super sturdy and everything worked out great.
customer_reviews.author: AvatarJennie

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately unstable
customer_reviews.text: I wanted these to work SO much. We have a scaredy cat (a rescue) that lives under our bed. We used two sets for our king bed as described in the instructions. After one night of sleeping on the bed I set a load of laundry on the bed and the bed collapsed trapping our cat under the bed. Thankfully she was fine. I cannot imagine if you were doing any "activities" in bed that these would be stable enough.
customer_reviews.author: R.Bear

customer_reviews.title: Not just for beds!
customer_reviews.text: Instead of for the bed, I used these on my living room couch because people complained about it being so low. It looks good and "sits" good now. And the mahogany looks very custom.
customer_reviews.author: Darla

customer_reviews.title: I was willing to make do with how bad they looked if they only worked - we wanted ...
customer_reviews.text: These don't work at all if you have regular cylindrical legs on your bed frame. I was willing to make do with how bad they looked if they only worked - we wanted to raise our bed for storage underneath. We installed these and I had my spouse "flop" onto the bed to represent a worst-case scenario in bed movement and all four immediately shifted off and the bed fell down to the floor. I can only see these working if the legs/feet of your bed fit 100% into the square notch and you only ever lightly sit into your bed.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: My couch is too low which makes it hard to get up. With the lifter, the couch is now the perfect height. Makes an amazing difference. So much easier to get up now.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: A great solution for sinking or low furniture
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a set similar to this for years either under my bed frame or to raise a cedar chest over a heating vent. My age old sofa and love seat started to collapse, so I got a second set to handle the two pieces of furniture. These are quite solid. If you intend to use them as a permanent fix, I would use the attached pegs to join them to the legs of the furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Benson

customer_reviews.title: Great lifters that raised my drafting table
customer_reviews.text: I picked these up for a drafting desk that I also use as my computer workstation. Unfortunately the desk's pullout tray, combined with the drafting chair I'm using gives very little leg room. So I bought these one night (impulse buy one night) and the next day, I noticed that the legs of the drafting table were rectangular and not round. Luckily, these lifters were compatible with the desk. The only knock I have about them is that they can slide around the floor and not very secure, but I don't plan jostling too much with the desk.
customer_reviews.author: avex

customer_reviews.title: Simple solution for a table that needs a little more height
customer_reviews.text: It's a very simple product - blocks of wood with a cube cut out of them. My table has square legs with no metal feet, so I needed something that the legs would fit into. These worked perfectly. They come close to matching the wood of the computer table I have, and the chair now fits under it with a little bit of clearance. The only thing I'd warn is that it's naked rough (stained) wood on the ends, so if you're going to put it on hardwood flooring, you'll need some kind of protector on the bottom of them like you would for any other furniture. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Jack

customer_reviews.title: Solid and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: These are the only type of bed lifters I would ever use. I've purchased those black plastic ones before, but seriously, just looking at a bed on top of those makes me cringe. These wooden bed lifters are just that -- solid wood. They are sturdy, with deep areas for the legs of the bed frame to fit. I've got them under two beds, and they easily hold the bed, mattresses, two people, etc. without moving. I'm not worried about the bed falling off with my house guests on top!
customer_reviews.author: AmyThink

customer_reviews.title: Nice Risers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to raise my sofa and love seat for my mom who is elderly and disabled. Originally I had concrete blocks under the legs but I hated the way that looked. These risers came in great condition, no scratches or chips. They are sturdy and look as if they are a part of the furniture. They add about 3 inches to the height of the furniture and make it so much easier for my mom to stand from a sitting position. They appear to be well made and solid. I am happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Functional and nice looking GERD relief
customer_reviews.text: These wood blocks are just what I've been looking for to elevate ONLY THE HEAD of a full size bed for relief of GERD. I used the included small blocks to drop into the cavity intended for the bed post feet and doing so gave me just about 4" of lift. Not so much as to put strain on the solid wood bed frame, as with taller risers. Also, the smaller outer dimension of these risers does not force one into having the headboard 6 or more inches from the wall. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: McLean-ite

customer_reviews.title: Espresso toned Wood Bed and TV Lifters are Solid
customer_reviews.text: Used for our New 2019 55" TV legs, they worked better than I thought. Raised it above my sound bar just above eye level, easier on the neck during long couch Theater sessions. These wood Lifters are larger than I thought shown in pictures seem smaller but measurement is accurate. Solid Blocks of wood. The Espresso Finish matches my Dark cherry tv stand nicely, close enough. They also allow the TV to be slid into place easier. The Finish is not high quality but not bad either, don't expect perfection.
customer_reviews.author: GZ

customer_reviews.title: Picture is misleading
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be missing two wooden blocks based on the picture, but my husband explained that if you want the additional height option, you'd have to buy another set anyway (then you'd have four total!). We don't need the extra height, so it's no matter for us. FYI, the espresso came a little more redish in color than I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Nessa L.

customer_reviews.title: Good As Couch Risers Too
customer_reviews.text: We bought these as risers for our couch, which was difficult to get off of if you're a tall guy (6'2") like me. These worked perfectly, I can now easily get off the couch without straining my knees or having to hoist myself up from the ground. We just have the couch resting on these for the moment, but we will be bolting them on to the feet when we get a chance (probably when we move furniture around for Christmas decorating). The couch sits against a wall, and we have carpet in our living room, so everything is very stable. I'm not sure how stable these would be on hardwood, or tile.
customer_reviews.author: J. Reid

customer_reviews.title: These blocks will give you lady wood!
customer_reviews.text: Have you ever purchased the plastic bed risers from the big box store just to have the bed frame pop thru the top of them, scare you to death, make you scream so loud the neighbors talk about you over the fence, and your bed be un-level and cattywompous? It won't happen with these bad mamajammers! They are solid blocks of wood! I would have liked them a touch taller to accommodate the various empty diet coke bottles and random bags of chex mix and cats that find their way under my bed, but they are great for the price and construction!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Solid Hardwood gets the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: These are solid wood bed lifters. If you have a heavy frame bed and you need to raise it up a few inches, then this is a product for you. Initially I had bought some plastic versions, but they quickly broke after a few months due to the plastic stretching and deforming. As the product info states, these are solid wood blocks and do the job as advertised. My only complaint is that I wish they shipped with 5 to a box, as I needed one on the center support for my bed frame.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These worked wonderfully! We have a short bedframe from Ikea and I wanted to raise it just enough to be able to slide storage boxes underneath. I didn't know these wood block lifters existed at the time and thought my only option was going to be those big plastic triangle shaped ones. These wood bed lifters are great! The color comes close to matching our bed frame, and it lifted it just enough to use the underneath for storage. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: B.Smith

customer_reviews.title: and me and my better half on it
customer_reviews.text: We have a set of these wood risers for our bed and haven't had any issues with them; no cracking or wood shearing off. With the weight of the bed, and me and my better half on it, the blocks are supporting over 450+ lb. Bed doesn't move but the dollar store version of the gripper shelf liner cut in pieces to fit under each block would do the trick to keep them from scooting on a smooth surface floor (we have tile). In process of ordering a second set so we can increase underbed clearance for storage. These are a great price and worth ever penny.
customer_reviews.author: Robin L

customer_reviews.title: These look good, but our couch had much smaller feet and ...
customer_reviews.text: These look good, but our couch had much smaller feet and bumping the couch sent it off the risers so we had to send them back. These would be good if your feet are 2" square or so. Even then, get a piece of secure double stick pad to anchor them to the risers.
customer_reviews.author: Joie McClements

customer_reviews.title: These lifters are wonderful. Both strong and attractive
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to raise my office desk and my co-workers have threatened to steal them. My desk was on the low side and there was not enough room to fit my under-desk eliptical machine. These lifters are wonderful. Both strong and attractive. I bought 2 sets to be sure they were able to withstand the weight of a sold-wood desk fully loaded, but I'm not sure that was even necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Lmaris

customer_reviews.title: Lifters themselves are fine, but one of the inserts to allow stacking ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two sets of used lifters. Lifters themselves are fine, but one of the inserts to allow stacking was cracked / split. Since I don't need the stacking insert, I opted not to return, but disappointed in the outgoing quality control of these lifters.
customer_reviews.author: Muffinhead89

customer_reviews.title: Holy Humpty Dumpty they Rolled my Mother in Law!!
customer_reviews.text: I read some of the reviews about the bed falling off and thought people were being rough on the bed. I purchased mine for a guest bed for guest for thanksgiving. I was completely embarrassed when my mother in law (Maybe 145lbs) sat on the bed and it took a tumble. I just was going to return it and low and behold, my return line closed 10 days ago! Maybe some one will reach out to me and return these for me, but in this "Gotcha" world we live in, I'm not very hopeful!
customer_reviews.author: MommaP

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to raise a very tall and heavy wardrobe style desk for a rather tall coworker so his knees would go under the keyboard tray. They did the trick, and seem sturdy enough to hold the weight (about 600lbs). As for the finish, I have a mahogany bed and there is noway they would match, they are way too red. If I were going to use these for the purpose of raising my bed, I would definitely sand and refinish them. To me the extra work would be no big deal, but if you don't want to go through that process, you might want to try a different item.
customer_reviews.author: kepi

customer_reviews.title: Four of the eight ordered were broken, three of those, broken beyond repair
customer_reviews.text: Ordered eight blocks. Three of them were broken beyond repair, with the possible exception of a lot of gorilla glue. The 4th is significantly cracked. The other four are supporting my twin bed, but thankfully I don't live in the house where kids jump on the bed, can I not planning to plop on it. They raised the bed nicely. I like got their wood and stained the color but I chose. As I recall they were cheap in price so no great loss but I'll see if I can get a refund for the ones that are not usable.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I dislike these bed raisers. Very poor quality product. They’re not finished on the inside , needs to be sanded . I wanted to send it back but unfortunately shipping that crap back would cost me and free drop off options are not anywhere close by . I don’t recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: They do the job.
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended by my husband's physical therapist to raise our sofa and loveseat. I tried another brand, but didn't like the light color. I kept these, although the furniture tends to slide in them a little and one time one of them tipped over. The furniture legs are square and the holes in the risers are square. The light-colored risers had round holes and thus less room for the square legs to slide. I'm thinking of getting modeling clay or something to fill in the holes. Otherwise, the finish is nice, and I'm pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Granny

customer_reviews.title: Not four inches high
customer_reviews.text: As I get older, my knees have a tougher time elevating the rest of me off my living room sofa. I couldn't afford a new sofa, so decided to try these bed lifters instead. From the description, I expected them to raise the sofa by four inches, but since the top is recessed, they only raise it by 2.75 inches -- which they tell you on the box, but not in the Amazon description. They did exactly what I wanted in all other respects, so I ordered another set because they are stackable.
customer_reviews.author: bobsmom

customer_reviews.title: oh yeah! This is great!
customer_reviews.text: I put these under the legs of my couch, the bed being high enough, thank you, and it has worked out beutifully. I have two little odd blocks left over and I am hesitant to throw them out because the qualith of wood is very high and one never knows, right? These things lift the couch off the floor so we don;t have to struggle up grunting and moaning each time the door bell rings. They are solid, sturdy and they do NOT sluip around. They;ve been under that couch for si months now and I would suggest these to anyone for any reason. Beautiful (the plastic ones are temporary) strong and impossible to notice.
customer_reviews.author: David Seaman

customer_reviews.title: Lifted my couch perfectly. Careful if you're lifting a ...
customer_reviews.text: Lifted my couch perfectly. Careful if you're lifting a bed, one set will not do. You'll need to buy 2. One only raises about 2.5 inches, unless your bed covers the whole 4" surface, it has a deep depression.
customer_reviews.author: Walter A. Avalos

customer_reviews.title: just what I needed at a fair price!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to securely elevate the headboard end of a queen mattress bed frame on 2 1/2 inch rollers on an uneven hardwood floor. The floors are old and uneven in a summer cottage. We had put 2 by 4 inch blocks building the headboard end up because otherwise you feel like your head is sliding towards the wall. Well if you roll around at night you run the risk of having the homemade elevation blocks roll out from under the bed frame. Two of these blocks under the headboard end elevate the bed frame almost 3 inches which is all we really needed. Until the floors are fixed this fixes our problem.
customer_reviews.author: marjala

customer_reviews.title: One was chipped otherwise these were what I expected. ...
customer_reviews.text: One was chipped otherwise these were what I expected. One option the manufacturer should consider is a double ended screw rather than the metal rods that just slip through the bottom when you stack 2 of the blocks. Screwing them together from the inside would make a sturdier foot and I know I would feel more secure that my bed won't "jump" off the risers. To counter my fears I just ordered more so I can have more support closer together. Hopefully this will help.
customer_reviews.author: M. Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Very attractive!
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful and very attractive, just like the picture. And I loved the fact they are 'stacking' so if I want my bed even higher, I can buy another set!! Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Helpful Hannah

customer_reviews.title: These have held up for over a year and really add a great amount of clearance under my bed
customer_reviews.text: These were bulky and felt expensive for such a simple product, but they served their purpose. I remember having bed risers in college, but since getting out into the real world and needing to store products underneath my Queen-sized bed, I wanted something a little classier than the traditional plastic ones. These have held up for over a year and really add a great amount of clearance under my bed; I can store an entire twin-sized mattress underneath mine now.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Rise to the Occasion
customer_reviews.text: Solid wood risers fit my castor wheels just fine. I needed a bit more storage space under my bed so these handy little blocks worked well. My bed is now at least 3" taller. There is an option to stack these with another set but I think I'm fine with just one. There are metal dowels included for stability if you do decide to stack these. The wood blocks are made in China and it would be nicer to find some made here but. . . they do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: These risers were exactly what I needed to lift our bed to the right height to accommodate the bedskirt I replaced. Now the bedskirt sits exactly where I want it and it's not touching the floor.
customer_reviews.author: wwahine

customer_reviews.title: Very Functional
customer_reviews.text: These work well to elevate the table or whatever that you need be higher up. Just keep in mind that the legs of your item have to fit inside the grooved out spaces. They are solidly made and decently stained. Once you stand back to admire, you should also realize that the whole look is not going to be elegant, but more utilitarian. I actually draped a tablecloth over the whole thing to hide where the legs connected to the risers (I'm creating a "beauty station" out of a couch table I had.) to improve the overall look.
customer_reviews.author: SOEXCITEDUSA

customer_reviews.title: If it's too high then your too young.
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit I was going to sell my L-shaped sofa until I stumbled upon this product. It's like I have been suffering all this time for no reason. I'm just taller than average but most furniture is just too short. This is the great equalizer. Plus I have these crazy hospital trays I use for my laptop in the living room and up until now I couldn't get under the sofa with the legs. I'm going to try these on the bed now to get some storage under the bed. Wow, I'm getting old because this really sounds like a good idea. Peace and Love.
customer_reviews.author: ACM78415

customer_reviews.title: I live in a small apartment and got a myself ...
customer_reviews.text: I live in a small apartment and got a myself a small deep freezer, I have a tall kitchen table but it wasn't quite tall enough for me to move my freezer in and out from under it. So I bought these to give it a little boost. They work perfectly, but the legs of my table are way way smaller than the wholes cut out for a bed frame, which I knew they would be when I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: alicia

customer_reviews.title: I plan to get another set for my love seat.
customer_reviews.text: They worked. I used them to raise my living room sofa up a few inches, which helps with getting up from the sofa after sitting. I had to modify the lifts by cutting notches to accommodate the with of the sofa's legs. I plan to get another set for my love seat.
customer_reviews.author: WOWS

customer_reviews.title: Saved my back
customer_reviews.text: I got these shortly after moving to where my new furniture was too low to get out of easily. (back surgery) I got a set for my chair and a set for the couch. They work beautifully and except for my 2 year old granddaughter, everyone says they make it easier to rise from the seating. Thanks, guys! UPDATE: bought 2 more sets for recliners and gave a neighbor a set for her Adirondak chair...she loved them and is so grateful she can get in and out of her chair with no struggle. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: barbara

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: We needed a little lift to our bed to be able to fit storage boxes underneith. These are not only the perfect height, but they look nice so as they peek out from under our bed skirt, you see finished wood that looks like bed legs rather than ugly plastic pyramids. It surprised me that they are so heavy, but again, that helps them stay in place and not move around, unlike the cheapo plastic versions that don't seem sturdy at all. We even bought a set for our guest bedroom and doubled our storage!
customer_reviews.author: Underwater girl

customer_reviews.title: These solid and nicely finished little guys rock
customer_reviews.text: These solid and nicely finished little guys rock! Put them under the legs of an Ikea Ektorp sofa which was so low to the ground that we were all getting hip pain from sitting on it. Took one person under 5 minutes to install, and presto! the couch is now high enough to sit comfortably and totally solid and secure. BTW, they come with cubes that fit between them, so if you need more height, you can securely stack them. And they match my hardwood floors. Absolutely great buy; couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: SVC

customer_reviews.title: Made in China, not completely finished
customer_reviews.text: I like that they are wood rather than plastic, but they are not completely finished, there is some sanding that was left undone. And they are made in China, but they fit the bed well and raise the bed securely with no wobble. In fact, you wouldn't know the bed was on lifters unless you saw them.
customer_reviews.author: E. Yahn

customer_reviews.title: the perfect solution
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased my new pillow top mattress bed set, I had no idea it would be so high. My existing nightstand was way too low after installing the new bed. I had tried other means of raising it that frankly looked tacky. Came across these and ordered them immediately. They arrived promptly, the wood matched my bed and night stand pretty darn closely, and they work like a charm. Probably the best possible solution other than buying a new nightstand, which I shopped around for! If I need anything else raised up will absolutey purchase another set of these.
customer_reviews.author: MarciaM

customer_reviews.title: These Risers are terrific. We purchased 2 sets for lifting our sofa ...
customer_reviews.text: These Risers are terrific. We purchased 2 sets for lifting our sofa and love seat higher off the ground. By doing this we can clean much easier under this furniture. The Risers lift everything just enough to actually make the furniture more comfortable to sit on. We have dogs and cleaning is always an issue. Now, with these risers cleaning is much easier. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Marivic

customer_reviews.title: Also works great for tables
customer_reviews.text: I bought a bar height dining room set several years ago, and while the table still looks brand new, the chairs didn't stand up so well. After replacing the chairs with a more padded model, I quickly realized that there wasn't enough clearance under the table, and so I purchased these lifters to remedy that problem. Literally seconds after receiving them, I was able to use my beloved dining table with no comfort issues, and the finish on these lifters is a perfect match to my table, so unless you're actively looking, you'd never know.
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt E Beougher

customer_reviews.title: Great for a desk
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected. Using them on a desk with 2" square legs. They give a nice boost and are stable on a hardwood floor (add felt to avoid scratches). Honestly I dont think I would ever use this on a bed but for a desk great.
customer_reviews.author: pcseller

customer_reviews.title: TV stand risers
customer_reviews.text: Maybe a little overkill but they are exactly what I was looking for to raise our tv legs so the sound bar fits underneath. Reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Jered H

customer_reviews.title: fully functional
customer_reviews.text: Holds up CA king size bedframe & mattress with two 200-lb people and about 20 lbs of cats. They look a little weird though, very chunky/blocky compared with the legs of the wooden bedframe.
customer_reviews.author: C.D.R.

customer_reviews.title: A bit of a mess.
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews, but these bed risers were covered in a very sticky, lumpy substance (similar to pine pitch) and appeared to have been thrown around before they were packed! As well as the sticky stuff, they were chipped and scuffed. They are definitely ‘easy to install’ - you just stick them under your bed frame or headboard. I cleaned them off and am using them, as it is too much of a pain to return them. In conclusion, buy at your own risk!!!
customer_reviews.author: Vandy G

customer_reviews.title: Sleeping higher
customer_reviews.text: They work perfectly! My sister and I both have sleep number beds and without the $2,000 base, their beds are low These risers put our beds up to the perfect level!
customer_reviews.author: psialady

customer_reviews.title: These work great and match our dark mahogany bed perfectly
customer_reviews.text: These work great and match our dark mahogany bed perfectly. I can now easily slide the suitcases underneath the bed. No one even notices the lifters. I ordered Espresso for our dark bed and it worked great. They aren't super high. I purchased 2 sets and they stack easily and securely.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth G.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our needs
customer_reviews.text: I've seen some less-than-pleasant reports. I'll note that the lifts (1) arrived in a timely fashion (2) were not cracked, or defective in any way and (3) fit the bottoms of our sofas ... which are standard straight-leg style ... with room to spare. I would not recommend stacking them more than two high for added height, lest they get wobbly, and if your furniture has more stiletto-type legs, seek something with a thinner profile. But for us, they were exactly as advertised, and exactly what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Long John Sliver

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected. No support to keep thinner leg stable inside squares.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good build quality but does not work well on carpet
customer_reviews.text: In theory, this is a good idea, but on carpet, just does not work well. They consistently tip over whenever you push the bed or lean on the bed. They get caught on the carpet and roll over, so now you have the bed uneven. We have not tried them on hardwoods, I imagine that it would work better on that, but I can't speak for certain. The build quality is good and they delivered what was promised, but it just didn't work well.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: As described plus some...
customer_reviews.text: Product just as described. Also came with two finished wooden inserts and metal rods which would allow you to combine two lifters for a ~7 inch height. But you would need two sets in order to make use of this on four-legged furniture. I sawed the two 1-inch tall inserts in half along the 1-inch height, laid them in the depression for an additional ~1/2 inch of lift. And this makes things look a little better since the inside of the depression isn't finished. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: DJJJS

customer_reviews.title: are very sturdy, simple design and stackable
customer_reviews.text: These work very well, are very sturdy, simple design and stackable. Unfortunately, I ordered the wrong color (my wife wanted the darker color and I did not check with her first!) I had to return these, however, we bought another set with the correct color and love them!
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Robert M.J. Hagopian

customer_reviews.title: Risers Used in the Living Room
customer_reviews.text: These risers are actually meant for lifting beds to a higher level, but I used mine in the living room to raise my couch and chair. I've been wheelchair-bound, and this was a next step toward independence--to be able to get up, after sitting down, from my living room furniture. The maple color was also perfect for me--not an exact match, but a good blend.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Works for GERD acid reflux
customer_reviews.text: I used these to raise the head of my bed by 6". I needed two purchases of it so I could also raise the central legs. The middle of the bed then required about a 2" elevation which I provided by other means. My nocturnal GERD acid reflux lowered right away.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Robot

customer_reviews.title: Not really worth it
customer_reviews.text: This doesn’t make any sense. There are only 2 small little blocks, when there are 4 block pieces. It doesn’t make sense. Wound up mixing 2 of the blocks with 2 other block sets and put the remaining aside.
customer_reviews.author: Jem

customer_reviews.title: Wood blocks fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: These blocks worked perfectly to lift a twin bed to a more "adult" height. Used them on wooden bed legs that are 3 3/4" x 3 3/4".
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive excellent quality and strong.
customer_reviews.text: Although it looks more like cherry than mahogany, it works very well. I bought it for sofa and love seat so that iRobot can go under them easily. As a bonus the pack had risers which also helped in raising the couch. I love this product.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the wood was very good; however
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the wood was very good; however, I was disappointed in 2 things: 1) that the color was not a closer match (only 2 colors were available); and 2) that a narrower version was not available: the circumference of the legs of my desk was much smaller than the size of the lifters, so the overall appearance of the legs in the lifters resembled a small sapling in a huge planter, or a little girl wearing her mother's high-heeled shoes.
customer_reviews.author: mtlgal

customer_reviews.title: Works great if you only raise the bed with one set of lifters.
customer_reviews.text: I bought enough of these so that I could stack an addittional set so it was 2 blocks high but the bed became very unstable and started to fall off the lifters. I works great if you only use 1 block high. I would not recommend more than that.
customer_reviews.author: Ted J.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: They do the job. sturdy and it's a lot cheaper on here than on walmart.com
customer_reviews.author: samantha zimmer

customer_reviews.title: Love these! Sturdy and Attractive
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 sets of 4 of these for my new Queen-sized bed (since it had 6 legs) and I could not be happier. They are so sturdy and support each leg perfectly. I have only once heard them kind of rock, but my bed did not fall off. They are also very attractive, which was important since even though I got a 17" bed skirt, you can still see them sometimes. I am a designer and am very particular about these things, but I love them. I definitely recommend them over the plastic ones for looks and quality.
customer_reviews.author: SillySamantha

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: We use two sets of these lifters, stacked one on top of the other, raising the bed approximately 8". I think using only one set would be ideal, but using two appears safe and stable so far. I would caution, however, that the stands do have a tendency to shift over time. If I didn't check and readjust them once every week or so, I think they would shift enough over time that they'd likely slip out from under the frame and the bed would fall.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: I have plastic risers that lasted years before a piece ...
customer_reviews.text: I have plastic risers that lasted years before a piece broke off the side of one of them but still using these under a sofa. I recently purchased a set of the wooden ones to use under a living room sofa-2 months and 11 days and the side broke off one of them. These are made of cheap pine. My son will glue the broken piece back in place but it will only be a matter of time before it's repair time again or time to toss.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Ann Sechoka

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a toddler bed or crib!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use the space below my son's crib that converts to a toddler bed. (I got the cheap one at Ikea.) It fits perfectly. I was worried about the plastic ones breaking through. Not because if weight, but because my 2 year old is constantly jumping in his bed. These are great. Only 3 inches high, which gives enough room for storage bins and he can still get in and out of bed easily. Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: tizpear

customer_reviews.title: Bed Lifters Do the Trick
customer_reviews.text: These bed lifters did the trick for my 1960's bed that was a little low. It looks better raised plus I have more room to store things underneath. The lifters come in different wood tones; the mahogany look better with my bed and in the room. I would recommend these as a quality product. I did not do much comparison pricing but I definitely know I got my money's worth with the ease of shopping with Amazon and their prompt shipment.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy D. Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: Not what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the risers that are pictured. The ones in the picture are solid below the leg holders. The ones pictured are stacked by shifting 45 deg. I ordered these to match a set we have had for way over a decade. The ones I recieved are holow under the leg holders and small legs could punch through like most of the plastic ones. Before I order something chances are that I have taken time to research what I order. I expect to get what I order or something much beter if replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Don Guy

customer_reviews.title: Shorter than I imagined but very sturdy. I think eventually I may buy a second ...
customer_reviews.text: Shorter than I imagined but very sturdy. I think eventually I may buy a second set to raise my daughter's bed a bit higher so that she can fit her trampoline under her bed.
customer_reviews.author: Cckbgood

customer_reviews.title: Best risers I've used yet!
customer_reviews.text: I went through a couple of different types of risers on my queen bed (one set was plastic/rubber and the other was plastic/acrylic)- both sets cracked/slid/wobbled. This set is super-sturdy and I have them sitting on berber carpet. The casters on my bed fit perfectly inside. The bed hasn't wobbled once (I've had these for several months) and I don't go to sleep in fear of tipping over any more! Yay for peace of mind!
customer_reviews.author: ASmith

customer_reviews.title: Serving its purpose
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to help support a sectional couch that was recently purchased. My sectional couch looks as though it is missing two legs, which it isnt. Since I felt that it needs additional legs or support, I bought these bed risers to put under the visible portions of the couch. The brown wood matches the legs on the couch, so it works perfectly. Now my furniture is supported and I feel comfortable sitting in that area now. The packaging was perfect, no damage to the package or the contents. It was worth paying the extra freight fee to receive in 2 days. I would recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Krystle

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THEM!!! Now I can get off the sofa!
customer_reviews.text: I have some 10 inch bed risers somebody gave me. Wayyyyyyy too tall. I've been thinking of getting some new sofas bec I can barely get off of them since I've injured my back and new onset of arthritis to my knee. These were perfect! Solid blocks of wood. Perfect color. Exactly the color of light honey. I bought one set for the sofa ...not I am purchasing a second set for the love seat. Best part I get to keep my sofas! Not bad for less than $40 investment.
customer_reviews.author: Winn

customer_reviews.title: looks great and does exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: compared to the conical shaped bulky bed lifters, this wood lifter is aesthetically much more pleasing. The measurements listed are accurate and it is holding a hospital bed very stable. It has accomplished exactly what we needed it to do - to raise the bed so an elderly person can more easily stand up from a sitting position on the bed.
customer_reviews.author: ktn

customer_reviews.title: I am so incredibly happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am so incredibly happy with this purchase! So much so that I bought another set immediately after I recieved the first set. I layered the two sets and have placed two blocks under each foot of my bed. I absolutely love the added height. The blocks are well built and sturdy and look nice if they show under your bedskirt, more so than those cheap looking plastic ones. If you're looking to add an extra bit of class and height to your bed, these are definitely the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: Nika H.

customer_reviews.title: Best bed risers
customer_reviews.text: These are so much better and more attractive than the standard plastic ones that make you feel like you're living in a dorm. I have large underbed storage containers that didn't fit under our bed frame due to carpeting in the bedroom, so these risers were the perfect lift to get those containers under the bed with plenty of room. Also, they are real wood!
customer_reviews.author: Mags

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Arrived new in box, as described. I put them under my couch last week and they are sturdy and stable.
customer_reviews.author: sz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and looks nice.
customer_reviews.text: These were PERFECT to raise my grandson's bed up just enough for the trundle bed to clear, the wood grain looks nice and matches his bed, plus all others were too large and would interfere with the trundle clearance.
customer_reviews.author: DIY Gramma

customer_reviews.title: Unstable Risers
customer_reviews.text: I previously had those plastic bed risers but decided to but the wooden ones, thinking they would be more durable and last longer. These risers can be stacked two on each other with a center peg to make the riser a little higher but it was so unstable and if you lean on the edge of your bed, it collapses. This happened twice and I finally took them off for safety reasons. The plastic risers were much sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: 808shopper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our purpose which was to secure storage space for our on-board luggage and small packpacks. One block provided this space quite adequately. Be forewarned that some King-sized bed frames may require 6 blocks to accommodate center supports. We wish that the company had anticipated this and offered a King-sized 6-pack kit. Fortunately, we had bought an exra kit in anticipation of needing two blocks on each leg. We avoided the inconvenience of reordering, but still bear the expense of the extra kit.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce M.

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: Nice finish. They look terrible under my wingback recliner, BUT, my husband loves the extra height!
customer_reviews.author: Gail M.

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Not at all as advertised. These are pieces of wood glued together, and not a solid block. Beware--you're not getting a quality product when you purchase these.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally purchased chairs that were too y’all so I purchased these to elevate the table . Perfect height now
customer_reviews.author: Tia

customer_reviews.title: Great but...
customer_reviews.text: REMEMBER TO BUY THEM FOR ALL THE POSTS YOUR BED MAY HAVE!If your bed has small posts...it's not good enough.Skinny posts slide around in the squares and can cause bending.Our bed broke...:-/. Dont just buy for the outer posts, if you bed has center posts underneath then you need an extra pack for ALL of them.
customer_reviews.author: KEW

customer_reviews.title: These seem to work for what I wanted them for...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to raise a small computer table to a better height for my comfort and someone suggested using bed raisers. I looked in a number of local stores but all there was were plastic raisers, and thought the wooden ones looks much nicer for a table. I received them quite quickly and with some struggle managed to lift up the table and place these lifters under the wheels. The height seemed perfect and the table seemed fairly stable. So I was happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AmyF

customer_reviews.title: Good choice from Amazon- Looks good and works well but...
customer_reviews.text: I chose these blocks to raise my den couch because of a)the real wood look and b)because they were stackable (in case I wanted to raise my couch more than one block high). I ended up using on;y one block per leg, and what I did not realize ws that sionce they were going on a stone flor, there would be some unevenness. The only issue I have not silved is that the blocks that fit loosely tend to move or swivel if you touch them while cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: S. Katz

customer_reviews.title: Very strong.
customer_reviews.text: Although they're not for my mid century sofa, they're beautiful enough for me not to care.
customer_reviews.author: A. Flores

customer_reviews.title: Wood Bed Lifters (Mahogany) - A Perfect Solution
customer_reviews.text: Although these are advertised as bed lifters, I needed needed something to raise a sofa in my office and didn't want those black cone shaped ones. This is the perfect solution for my sofa woes.. They are sturdy, solid and stable. My sofa has a skirt and these lifters are barely noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: iglad

customer_reviews.title: I don't normally write reviews but these are horrible. Do not buy them
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write reviews but these are horrible. Do not buy them. They are not sturdy and the bed will fall off of them. I would give 0 stars if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent chair risers after Back Surgery
customer_reviews.text: Best risers for the money for the 3 to 4 inch rise that I needed in all my upholstered chairs to help me keep my back straight after surgery. Easy to place, attractive (especially compared to plastic) and solidly stable, even on a Lane recliner. I'm a little over 6 feet tall and furniture typically is sized for the smaller user. I had to correct that for my own rehabilitation and I'm going to keep my chairs tall for comfort!
customer_reviews.author: ceejay

customer_reviews.title: They look great (the stain on all 4 matched well enough)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to lift my bed up a couple of inches after I bought some under-bed storage containers that were a bit too tall. They look great (the stain on all 4 matched well enough), weren't damaged, and have held up my bed successfully for a few months now :) They look MUCH better than the plastic ones I've seen around, and those look a bit flimsy. These are solid blocks of wood, so as long as they don't arrive damaged, they should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: X. Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Well made and wonderful for senior
customer_reviews.text: I bought two sets, one for me and one for my Mother. She is in her 90's and getting up from her chair was difficult for her. She is so happy with her higher chair! She can get up much more easily and no longer has to stuff cushions under her to give the added height she needed. Mine I like because my love seat was fairly low and I am tall. It is much more comfortable and ergonomic with the risers, and I can run the vacuum under it now which is a big plus! The quality seems to be very good.
customer_reviews.author: neek

customer_reviews.title: These are the best. They are stackable (maximum of two) and they ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the best. They are stackable (maximum of two) and they are exceptionally sturdy. Do not buy the plastic ones as they just don't hold up for a bed. I had used two of the plastic ones to raise the head of the bed and the bed fell through.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry C. Welsh, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great little bed risers. I didn't want anything very tall, just a few inches worth, and these fit the bill far better than the overpriced plastic ones that kids get sent off to college with. They also look pretty handsome, and certainly smell like mahogany too. Couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow, good feet!
customer_reviews.text: These are big clunky wooden feet, exactly what I wanted. I put them under my couch so I can get up and down without assistance, my couch is a sectional so I needed three packs for that. I bought five sets, put a set under a table to make it counter height. Plan to use them under the bed as well to create more storage. I like that I can link two of them together with provided little metal rods if I wanted to. Might send some to mom!
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: These ARE AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: They arrived quickly... were easy to put in place and I LOVED THEM SO MUCH I bought a set for my daughter's couch! I have osteoarthritis in both of my knees and most average couches are just really low. The quality and price make these a wonderful solution... And because of the skirting around the bottom of my couch that look like they were there the whole time! Get them... Get two... You WILL BE PLEASED!!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy S

customer_reviews.title: not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Surprised to find one piece arrived broken in two pieces, and another had a defective corner (where corners are nailed on). These lifts are common pine, no finish - honey oak??? The "holes" that legs go into were quite small compared to the blocks, enough so that our back couch legs would not go into them. Something else I had to fix. Fortunately they "hide" under the couch skirt. I won't send them back but what junk they turned out to be.
customer_reviews.author: ropebed

product_meta.title: Richards Homewares 98041000 Espresso Wood Bed Lifters (Set of 4) Fits 2.75 x 2.75 Bed Feet
product_meta.description: Color:EspressoWooden Bed Risers are stylish and functional! Giving you 3.5" of extra space under your bed. Our patented design keeps a smooth look when stacking! Place the risers under the legs or wheels of the bed frame and get an additional 3.5" of height. Great for adding under-the-bed storage or for very tall people. Stackable--for a higher lift purchase two sets for up to 7" of height. PATENTED DESIGN D736607
feature_bullets: EXTRA STORAGE SPACE INSTANTLY - Storage space is always at a premium and hard to find in your home, an apartment or even in a dorm. The Bed Lifter is an easy solution to extra storage. You will now have extra room for clothing, shoes, gifts, gift wrap, toys, books, CD’s, DVD’s, Artwork and photo albums or almost anything you can think of. Just think of how much storage you have just gained instantly by using these bed lifters

EASY TO USE WITH ALMOST ANY BED - Universal Design to fit different bed styles. Can be used with square or round bed posts and with casters no more than 2.75” wide. Two sets may be needed for a King bed. One set of bed risers increases your underbed space is 2.75”. Can also be used to raise a Sofa’s height to allow storage underneath as well as ease

STACKABLE-Buy two sets and the extra storage space increases to 6.25”. Great when needing to store bulkier items such as quilts, blankets or sweaters under a bed. If you are tall, these bed risers raise your bed and make it easier to get into bed. Not made to stack more than two sets.
HIGH QUALITY - Durable wood stained with a espresso color looks beautiful. The bed risers are stylish as well as functional.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,705 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
